revised_title: Genetic Attractiveness and Extra-Pair Copulations in Zebra Finches
tldr: Female zebra finches choose extra-pair copulations with genetically attractive males, as they have higher song rates, better offspring, and more attractive traits. This discovery provides a mechanism for sexual selection in monogamous species and supports the "good genes" models of sexual selection.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
